About Me

My name is Veronica Rivera and I am a second year PhD student in Computational Media at the University of California, Santa Cruz. I am a member of the Assistive Sociotechnical Solutions for Individuals with Special Needs Using Technology (ASSIST) lab and am advised by Professor Sri Kurniawan.

My research is in Human-Computer Interaction, Assistive Technology, Education, and Computer-Supported Cooperative Work. I am primarily focused on creating interactive technology to help students with Autism Spectrum Disorders (ASD) better learn and work with their peers in the classroom. Before coming to UC Santa Cruz, I obtained a B.S in Joint Computer Science and Mathematics with a Concentration in Psychology at Harvey Mudd College, where I was a 4-year President's Scholar.

Download my CV.
